docs.snippet: From the picket lines to ballrooms filled with stars, Hollywood on Monday hoped for a deal to end a 3-month-old clash between striking writers and studios amid reports they could reach an agreement this week....
docs.lead_paragraph: "From the picket lines to ballrooms filled with stars, Hollywood on Monday hoped for a deal to end a 3-month-old clash between striking writers and studios amid reports they could reach an agreement this week," Reuters reports.
docs.abstract: From the picket lines to ballrooms filled with stars, Hollywood on Monday hoped for a deal to end a 3-month-old clash between striking writers and studios amid reports they could reach an agreement this week.

headline.main: Hollywood Hopes For Strike Settlement Soon

headline.main: New York Fashion Week | Oscar de la Renta

docs.snippet: Variety tries to disentangle the Oscar campaigns....
docs.lead_paragraph: Yeah, there's still probably going to be some complicated campaigning left to do for Hillary and Barack after tomorrow, but Variety notes that the current Oscar campaign has its share of ins and outs, too.
docs.abstract: Variety tries to disentangle the Oscar campaigns.

docs.snippet: BAFTA's are coming up soon, and one blogger says we should look for mischief....
docs.lead_paragraph: Next Sunday, the BAFTA's, usually a by-the-way event here in Oscar-land, will go off amid heightened interest, in part because there has been so little hoopla on the home front. Daniel Kenealy at Award's Daily spends some time staring at the English tea leaves and says advises that we look for mischief in the interplay of the top two categories -- best film and best director-- in spite of "Atonement's" commanding presence in both of them.
docs.abstract: BAFTA's are coming up soon, and one blogger says we should look for mischief.

docs.snippet: The money metric suggests which nominees are the top contenders for best picture....
docs.lead_paragraph: Risky Biz, which has been running some analytics on historical Oscar winners and vectoring with them with box office receipts, has reached the conclusion that in the last ten years, with one exception, the best picture win has gone to one of the two top grossing films.
docs.abstract: The money metric suggests which nominees are the top contenders for best picture.

docs.snippet: The Bagger does a little crowing about the Giants' Superbowl victory, while pretending to have found an Oscar angle.....
docs.lead_paragraph: Lemme see, the Giants win a historic Super Bowl victory over the smug overdogs from New England and the Bagger remembers that the movie "Giant" was nominated for 10 Academy Awards in 1956, with a win for director George Stevens. Not much of a hook? Who cares? He just wants to celebrate in some fashion and is planning on being miles away from the victory parade in Manhattan on Super Tuesday.
docs.abstract: The Bagger does a little crowing about the Giants' Superbowl victory, while pretending to have found an Oscar angle..

headline.main: In Search of the Elusive Oscar Angle
